content.description:
Ding Guanpeng, Chinese Painter Employed by the Qing Court, Portrait of Emperor Qianlong as the Bodhisattva Manjusri, circa 1765

Freer Gallery of Art, Smithsonian Institution, Washington, D.C.: Purchase â€” Charles Lang Freer

The emperor is dressed as a Tibetan Buddhist teacher (lama). The Bodhisattva Manjusri is a major figure worshiped in the Tibetan Buddhist religious tradition.
content.question: The painting can best be used to demonstrate which of the following about the Qing rulers?

choices.label: Their rejection of their native Manchurian religious traditions
Their attempts to create a new syncretic religion for their empire
Their use of religion to strengthen political control over their empire
Their use of art to make Manchu rule more acceptable to practitioners of Daoism

content.answer: Their use of religion to strengthen political control over their empire
